title.narrative: Sustainable Agriculture and Production Linked to Improved Nutrition Status, Resilience, and Gender Equity (SAPLING)

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): .The Sustainable Agriculture and Production Linked to Improved Nutrition Status, Resilience, and Gender Equity (SAPLING) is designed to improve gender-equitable food security, nutrition and the resilience of vulnerable people living in the five flood and landslide prone sub-districts of Bandarban District, Chittagong Hill Tracts. With FY 2020 funds, SAPLING will continue training on nutrition and health for women and adolescent girls and conduct growth monitoring for children under the age of two with the goal of improving their nutritional status. Agricultural support will focus on training, vermicomposting, and integrated homestead food production, including horticulture and poultry. In addition, the activity will strengthen networking and ties with the private sector and other service providers to develop a sustainable model that lasts even if the performance period is over. The activity will also facilitate community emergency preparedness and disaster risk reduction planning by training communities and volunteers, coordinating contingency planning, promoting awareness of early warning systems, and constructing disaster risk reduction infrastructure to mitigate the impact of shocks. The activity will build the capacity of the Chittagong Hill Tracts Authority to manage food security systems, strengthen traditional local governance systems, and build partnerships with leaders of different ethnic groups. ..This activity supports U.S. government's objectives to provide improved quality of life opportunities and enhance the people's lives to create a healthy, self-sufficient, resilient and sustainable economy in Bangladesh which supports the country's journey to self-reliance..
